name: Additive
description: Substances added to food to preserve flavor, enhance texture, or extend shelf life.
culinaryUses: Used in small quantities to improve food characteristics.
safetyConsiderations: Some additives may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals.

name: Bakery
description: Baked goods including bread, pastries, cakes, and cookies.
culinaryUses: Used as staple food items and sweet treats.
safetyConsiderations: Some baked goods may contain allergens such as eggs, milk, and nuts.

name: Beverage
description: Liquid refreshments that can be consumed for hydration or enjoyment.
culinaryUses: Served as refreshing drinks to quench thirst or accompany meals.
safetyConsiderations: Some beverages may contain allergens such as milk, nuts, and soy.

name: Beverage Alcoholic
description: Alcoholic drinks that contain ethanol.
culinaryUses: Consumed socially and in moderation for relaxation and celebration.
safetyConsiderations: Alcohol consumption may be harmful to health and should be avoided by some individuals.

name: Cereal
description: Edible grains used as staple food.
culinaryUses: Cooked or processed into various forms for breakfast cereals, bread, and more.
safetyConsiderations: Some cereals may contain allergens such as wheat, nuts, and soy.

name: Dairy
description: Milk-based products derived from mammals.
culinaryUses: Used in cooking, baking, and consumed as standalone products.
safetyConsiderations: Some dairy products may contain allergens such as milk and eggs.

name: Dish
description: Prepared meals or courses served on a plate or in a bowl.
culinaryUses: Varied dishes with unique flavors and ingredients from different cuisines.
safetyConsiderations: Some dishes may contain allergens such as milk, eggs, and nuts.

name: Essential Oil
description: Highly concentrated extracts from plants.
culinaryUses: Used in tiny quantities to add flavor and aroma to foods.
safetyConsiderations: Some essential oils may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals.

name: Fish
description: Aquatic animals consumed for food.
culinaryUses: Prepared in various ways including grilled, fried, or raw as in sushi.
safetyConsiderations: Some fish may contain allergens such as shellfish.

name: Flower
description: Edible flowers used in culinary applications.
culinaryUses: Used as garnishes or to add unique flavors and colors to dishes.
safetyConsiderations: Some flowers may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals.

name: Fruit
description: Edible sweet and fleshy seed-bearing structures.
culinaryUses: Consumed fresh, juiced, or used in desserts and various dishes.
safetyConsiderations: Some fruits may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals.

name: Fungus
description: Edible mushrooms and fungi.
culinaryUses: Used in various cuisines for their unique flavors and textures.
safetyConsiderations: Some fungi may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals. it is important to be able to identify edible mushrooms from poisonous ones.

name: Herb
description: Leaves of herbaceous plants used for culinary, medicinal, or aromatic purposes.
culinaryUses: Used to add flavor and aroma to various dishes and beverages.
safetyConsiderations: Some herbs may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals.

name: Legume
description: Seeds of leguminous plants used as food.
culinaryUses: Cooked or sprouted and used in soups, stews, salads, and more.
safetyConsiderations: Legume seeds may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals.

name: Maize
description: Edible grains or corn.
culinaryUses: Used as a staple food, ground into flour, or processed into various forms.
safetyConsiderations: Some maize products may contain allergens such as wheat, nuts, and soy.

name: Meat
description: Animal flesh used as food.
culinaryUses: Cooked by various methods, including grilling, roasting, and braising.
safetyConsiderations: Some meats may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals. be sure to cook meat thoroughly to avoid foodborne illness. begans and vegetarians should avoid meat products.

name: Nuts & Seed
description: Edible seeds and nuts from plants.
culinaryUses: Eaten raw or roasted, used in baking, desserts, and as snacks.
safetyConsiderations: Some nuts and seeds may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals. be sure to avoid cross-contamination with other allergens.

name: Plant
description: Edible parts of various plants used for food.
culinaryUses: Include vegetables, fruits, grains, legumes, nuts, and seeds.
safetyConsiderations: Some plants may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals.

name: Seafood
description: Edible aquatic animals and plants.
culinaryUses: Prepared in various ways, including steaming, grilling, and sushi.
safetyConsiderations: Some seafood may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals. begans and vegetarians should avoid seafood products. some seafood may contain high levels of mercury and should be avoided by some individuals.

name: Spice
description: Aromatic substances used to flavor food.
culinaryUses: Used in small quantities to add taste and aroma to dishes.
safetyConsiderations: Some spices may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals.

name: Vegetable
description: Edible parts of plants consumed as food.
culinaryUses: Used in cooking, salads, soups, and various dishes.
safetyConsiderations: Some vegetables may cause allergies or sensitivities in some individuals.
